review:
I just got the grinder and I got it working for idli batter.  
Mom says the batter is "light" aka airy. So hopefully so have great idlis
tmrw. Will be eager to see how it turns out.  
I thought of helping other to understand how "big" the steel drum is:  
I weighed (with weighing scale) that it can hold 5.25litre of water. That
means:  
1) 2litre of wet grinder = 5.25litre of water holding capacity  
2) 1litre of wet grinder = 2.7litre of water holding capacity (I simply halved
it. I don't own 1litre wet grinder)  
  
This should help you to understand how "BIG" ACTUALLY the steel drum is.  
Will update the review in coming months.  
Happy grinding!  
  
25 Sep 2017:  
Using this for almost 3 months. Working great. Batter turns out wonderful and
fluffy.  
1) One tip: After you are done grinding remove batter in a atleast 1litre +
large container than usual as the batter ferments well and becomes fluffy.
Earlier we used to remove in our regular patela... But noticed the batter
spills overnight during fermenting. So switched to larger patela.  
  
2) I also read some comments about lose lid.... Well I think the lid is not
suppose to fit AIR TIGHT... Otherwise how do you imagine air to get into the
batter while grinding??!!!  
If you are gentle and kind enough the lid should last you years if YOU ARE
CAREFUL.  
3) Batter that we make in this usually half the drum capacity last us one week
and use it three times a week. Mom grinds on Saturday... Use it for the week
following. We family of 3 maharashtraian with average skills of making idli
dosa. But this machine helps you reach better level with batter quality.  
4) It is not noisy at all. If you are used to television volume at normal
level you won't even notice this machine working at all.  
5) We usually grinder dal & rice together and leave it to run for 45min
without bothering it. Idlis and dosa turns out fantastic. Idlis are soft,
paper dosa is actually paper dosa and uttapa actually soft and fluffy.  
6) While grinding place the lid as it might get splashed a little. Not too
much but little.  
7) You will stop using mixer grinder for idli grinding for generations to
come.  
8) Add water while grinding in interval of 10-15min untill you figure out the
consistency. Once confident then you can add at once.  
9) Scoop out the batter with regular Karchi. After than remove the conical
stones in big plate and you can scoop the batter with hands.  
10) They give the scooper white in colour but my mom's is more comfortable
with hands than that plastic device.  
11) The motor heats up midly in 45min... Not much. That should bother you.  
12) Wash it yourself, wipe dry and assemble and keep it. Last thing you want
is maid to handle stones roughly.  
13) I like the design as it is easy to use and understand without not much
over do.  
  
When I get married I'm going to purchase one more of this and take it with me
as "Dahej" :P  
  
Best product on Amazon I ever purchased!

Good product, it has been six months still working fine.. In 2 litre grinder
this one is best

Love it.. !! Grinds so fast and smooth..!! Batter comes so fluffy!! yummy
idli!! Best product. and a must buy!! seen some negative comments as the lid
is not air tight!! Lid is just for the purpose to prevent dust entering into
the batter while grinding.!! air circulation is required whil grinding so the
lid serves its purpose.!!! for medium family this is the best grinder.

1) Well packaged and arrived in good condition  
2) Lovely idlis, dosa, vada, adai, pesarattu, etc have been made  
3) Did not buy Chappati Atta kneader or Coconut scraper; so cannot comment  
4) Easy to wash post flour preparation  
5) Suitable for family of 6 to 8 members - 6A + 2 C - in 1 round

Product delivered not that much good. noise coming from power button.

Amazon just request for Proper Packing and if you really want to get great

review:
Gud

Good

The grinder is awesome. I ground 1.2 kg of idli rice and 300g of urad dal
within an hour. The batter has come out get well.  
Tip: when you use it for the first time, grind something so that the smell of
stone and some powder from the stone gets washed away.  
Once ground and washed, use it for whatever you want.

Pretty good. Very high chance that you may receive misaligned drum and stone
resulting in poor grinding. I think this is because elgi does not check actual
gtinding. Don't worry. Just call elgi service and they will do a good job and
train u as well.

Best Quality with the grinder. Run time is decent, relatively less sound and
the battery is just right for a south Indian palate.  
Quick in Action - Very fast, 3 times faster than the normal grinder.Smooth and
best grinding - two conical stones makes wonders

Broken and used piece sent to me.

I had worse experience with the product. As part of Great Sales, this was 7250
Indian rupees. But while payment was made, it was 7650 Indian rupees. I'm so
concerned on the sale price and purchase price. I will stop buying any product
from this seller. This is really very bad and worst experience of buying from
Amazon.in

Elgi meets the standard as usual. Its been two weeks we started using and it
works fine. Grinder was well packed and delivered as promised.  
  
Overall experience is good.

So far so good. It's been 2 months and going good. This makes soft idlis. My
mom used to complain about the idlis becoming harder when the idli mix is
prepared in normal mixer grinder, and this came to our rescue.

RECEIVED THE ITEM IN TIME.HAVE STILL NOT STARTED USING IT.IT SHOULD BE OK.I
HAVE BEEN USING 1.25 LTR WET GRINDER OF SAME MAKE FOR THE LAST FEW
YEARS.HOPEFULLY THIS SHOULD ALSO BE GOOD.
